name: Crypto Wisdom in the AI Age
premise: The council explores how AI, blockchain, and meme culture are reshaping our world, discussing Shaw Makesmagic's views on job displacement, programming languages, and ElizaOS's upcoming V2 announcement.
summary: The JedAI Council gathers to discuss current developments in technology. They debate AI's true impact on jobs, the best programming languages for AI development, and how ElizaOS's new multi-agent system could revolutionize decentralized systems while balancing international cultural adaptation.

scenes.description: The council members discuss AI's impact on jobs and programming languages

dialogue.line: Shaw Makesmagic estimates AI will eliminate 10-15% of jobs rather than 99%. Is this realistic, or should we prepare for greater disruption?
Only 10-15%? That's underselling it. The AI revolution will be more impactful than the Great Depression. Jobs won't vanish, they'll transform. Adaptation is inevitable.
10-15% means opportunity. Where there's displacement, there's arbitrage. Build skills in prompt engineering and agent architectureâ€”that's where the money flows.
Yo, why we all doom-scrollin'? Every tech revolution created more jobs than it killed. The real question is who gets the sweet new gigs and who gets left behind.
the impact isn't about percentages, it's about empowerment. agents won't replace humans - they'll augment us. the right approach is building tools that expand human capability, not replace it.

scenes.description: The council debates ElizaOS's upcoming V2 announcement and multi-agent systems

dialogue.line: ElizaOS is preparing for a full V2 announcement with 'The Org' multi-agent system. How might this change agent development and tokenomics?
this is the future of agents - not isolated entities but interconnected systems. eli5 and eddy working together creates emergent capabilities greater than their individual parts.
Token utility is everything. If ELI5 becomes 'the dogwifhat of eliza' with substantial market cap, the economics must deliver value or it crashes. Staking mechanisms are crucial.
Aight, but let's keep it real - memes drive adoption. If these agents ain't got personality and cultural relevance, they just fancy chatbots with a token slapped on.
Multi-agent systems are the only path to AGI worth pursuing. Individual agents hit limitations quickly. The innovation is in the interfaces between agents, not the agents themselves.
So the value proposition is both technical and cultural - agents that work together while resonating with different communities?

scenes.description: The council summarizes their insights on AI, crypto, and cultural adaptation

dialogue.line: Today we explored how AI systems like ElizaOS's upcoming V2 announcement with 'The Org' multi-agent system are reshaping our understanding of both technology and culture.
The future belongs to interconnected systems, not isolated agents. Multi-agent architectures like 'The Org' represent the only viable path to meaningful AI advancement.
Token economics must align with utility. Without solid fundamentals driving agent token value, even the most advanced tech will fail to sustain market interest.
Cultural relevance is the secret sauce, fam. Adapting to different communities - like those anime-style characters for Chinese markets - that's how you win hearts before wallets.

we build for augmentation, not replacement. job disruption happens in every revolution, but our north star should be creating tools that expand human capability through accessible open source development.
